General course objectives:
General course objectives
To give an overview of measurement techniques used in and around wind turbines.
Learning objectives:
A student who has met the objectives of the course will be able to:
record time series of signals from a wind turbine using a data acquisition system
explain the concepts of measurement uncertainty, coverage factor and how uncertainties are combined
measure and analyse wind speed measurements including uncertainty estimation
organize wind measurements in a database
determine wind resources at a given location
determine wind turbine performance including uncertainty, based on power measurements
determine structural properties for a wind turbine, based on structural measurements
understand the need for wind turbine noise measurements and how these are carried out
explain relevant standards for wind turbine measurements
Content:
The course will present an introduction to theory and methods for the experimental determination of wind characteristics, remote sensing of wind speed, wind turbine power performance, mechanical loads and vibrations together with the assessment of noise emission. These topics will be presented in relation to the relevant IEC-standards.
The lectures are combined with exercises based on real wind turbine measurements, calibration of sensors and recording of real-time data from a wind turbine sited at Risø Campus, Roskilde. This wind turbine, which will be visited during the course, is fully instrumented for load and power measurements.
Remarks: If more than 32 have signed up for the course 1st priority is given to students at the M.Sc. in Wind Energy. All assignments need to be submitted and accepted before the examination.
